snippet: James Foley, a video journalist, was with Anton Hammerl, a South African photographer, when Mr. Hammerl was killed by the forces of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi in Libya. Now he is part of a team working to raise money for Mr. Hammerl's three children...
abstract: James Foley, a video journalist, was with Anton Hammerl, a South African photographer, when Mr. Hammerl was killed by the forces of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi in Libya. Now he is part of a team working to raise money for Mr. Hammerl's three children with a large-print auction at Christie's in New York.

headline.main: At Christie's, an Auction for Anton
